org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight

Class WeightLearningApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.linqs.psl.application.learning.weight.WeightLearningApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ModelApplication
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseGridSearch, GaussianProcessPrior, Hyperband, VotedPerceptron

    public abstract class WeightLearningApplication
extends Object
implements ModelApplication
    Abstract class for learning the weights of weighted mutableRules from data for a model. All non-abstract children should have a constructor that takes: (List, Database (rv), Database (observed)).

      • EVALUATOR_KEY

        public static final String EVALUATOR_KEY
        An evalautor capable of producing a score for the current weight configuration. Child methods may use this at their own discrection. This is only used for logging/information, and not for gradients.

      • inMPEState

        protected boolean inMPEState
        Flags to track if the current variable configuration is an MPE state. This will get set to true when computeMPEState is called, but besides that it is up to children to set to false when weights are changed.

    • Method Detail

      • learn

        public void learn()
        Learns new weights.

        The RandomVariableAtoms in the distribution are those persisted in the random variable Database when this method is called. All RandomVariableAtoms which the Model might access must be persisted in the Database.

        Each such RandomVariableAtom should have a corresponding ObservedAtom in the observed Database, unless the subclass implementation supports latent variables.

      • doLearn

        protected abstract void doLearn()
        Do the actual learning procedure.

      • setBudget

        public void setBudget(double budget)
        Set a budget (give as a proportion of the max budget). Child implementations should make sure to override this and call up the super chain.

      • getGroundRuleStore

        public GroundRuleStore getGroundRuleStore()

      • initGroundModel

        protected void initGroundModel()
        Initialize all the infrastructure dealing with the ground model. Children should favor overriding postInitGroundModel() instead of this.

      • initGroundModel

        public void initGroundModel(GroundRuleStore groundRuleStore)
        Init the ground model using an already populated ground rule store. All the targets from the obserevd database should already exist in the RV database before this ground rule store was populated. This means that this variant will not call ensureTargets() (unlike the no parameter variant).

      • initGroundModel

        public void initGroundModel(Reasoner reasoner,
                            GroundRuleStore groundRuleStore,
                            TermStore termStore,
                            TermGenerator termGenerator,
                            PersistedAtomManager atomManager,
                            TrainingMap trainingMap)
        Pass in all the ground model infrastructure. The caller should be careful calling this method instead of the other variant. Children should favor overriding postInitGroundModel() instead of this.

      • postInitGroundModel

        protected void postInitGroundModel()
        A convenient place for children to do additional ground model initialization.

      • initLatentGroundModel

        protected void initLatentGroundModel()
        The same as initGroundModel, but for latent variables. Must be called after initGroundModel(). Sets up a rule/term store stack meant for latent variables. The reasoner and TermGenerator can be reused (as they don't hold state). All non-latent variables (from the training map) will be pegged to their truth values.

      • computeMPEState

        protected void computeMPEState()

      • computeLatentMPEState

        protected void computeLatentMPEState()

      • computeObservedIncompatibility

        protected void computeObservedIncompatibility()
        Compute the incompatibility in the model using the labels (truth values) from the observed (truth) database. This method is responsible for filling the observedIncompatibility member variable. This may call setLabeledRandomVariables() and not reset any ground atoms to their original value. The default implementation just calls setLabeledRandomVariables() and sums the incompatibility for each rule.

      • computeExpectedIncompatibility

        protected void computeExpectedIncompatibility()
        Compute the incompatibility in the model. This method is responsible for filling the expectedIncompatibility member variable. The default implementation is the total incompatibility in the MPE state. IE, just calls computeMPEState() and then sums the incompatibility for each rule.

      • computeLoss

        public double computeLoss()
        Internal method for computing the loss at the current point before taking a step. Child methods may override. The default implementation just sums the product of the difference between the expected and observed incompatibility.
        Returns:
        current learning loss

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: ModelApplication
        Releases all resources used by this ModelApplication.
        Specified by:
        close in interface ModelApplication

      • setLabeledRandomVariables

        protected void setLabeledRandomVariables()
        Set RandomVariableAtoms with training labels to their observed values.

      • setDefaultRandomVariables

        protected void setDefaultRandomVariables()
        Set RandomVariableAtoms with training labels to their default values.

      • createAtomManager

        protected PersistedAtomManager createAtomManager()
        Create an atom manager on top of the RV database. This allows an opportunity for subclasses to create a special manager.

      • getWLA

        public static WeightLearningApplication getWLA(String name,
                                               List<Rule> rules,
                                               Database randomVariableDatabase,
                                               Database observedTruthDatabase)
        Construct a weight learning application given the data. Look for a constructor like: (List, Database (rv), Database (observed)).
